alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 7:18PM EDT until May 03 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Cumberland, Androscoggin and Sagadahoc Counties. For the Androscoggin River...including Gorham, Rumford, Auburn... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Androscoggin River near Auburn. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.8 feet, Route 136 at Stackpole Road in Durham floods to a depth of 1 foot. North River Road in Auburn floods. Water rises up to the retaining wall behind Roak Block on Main Street in Auburn. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM EDT Tuesday was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 9.7 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
